messages.message: Hi all, sorry for calling out here! May I ask if anyone knows who this user is `choitomas66` (email is the same under gmail). There is a local drive mounted under a repo of this user and it looks like a root path of a linux file system, and it includes a ton of files (e.g. `choitomas66/my-repo/fs/local-mount-1/sys/class/cpuid/cpu2/subsystem/cpu24/subsystem/cpu1/subsystem`) It doesn't look like this is intended and it is causing the file walker to spend lots of cycles on this drive.
Tomas Choi is a previous intern in infra @Heymian @shaunak is that his ID?

@Erick Thanks for confirming! @Heymian @shaunak Can we check latest activities under this account, such as newly mounted drive? Just wanted to make sure that this is not something unintended. I don't think I've seen the local mount above before

@Heymian, from the backup database, I can see that this drive `choitomas66/my-repo/fs/local-mount-1` is just mounted on `/`
I know that we've prohibited this lately, as this just mounts the root folder hosting pod. However, what if a user already mounted `/` before the patch? I think here we have a case like this:
